intro: Psychotria bayombongensis, commonly known as the Bayombong psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of Luzon. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
